Qst.hpid: Mr. J. Mitchell Mr. J. Mitchell
Qst.Quest: if, in view of the ongoing controversy in relation to the appointment of a full-time remedial teacher at a school (details supplied) in Dublin 7, she will meet a deputation of local Deputies and representatives of the management board and the parents association as soon as possible.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Ms Bhreathnach) Niamh Bhreathnach
Speaker.P: I am aware of the difficulties to which the Deputy refers. The issues in question were discussed at a recent meeting involving a senior member of my Department's inspectorate and representatives of the school in question.
The issues raised at that meeting have been noted by my Department and will be taken into account as part of an ongoing review of overall remedial allocations.

I would point out that the school in question has already been allocated two ex-quota teaching posts and that, in the context of the recent allocation of remedial posts, its level of remedial need was not deemed to be such as to warrant the allocation of a full-time remedial teacher to the school.
In the circumstances, I do not consider that the meeting requested would be useful.

Qst.hpid: Mr. N. Ahern Mr. N. Ahern
Qst.Quest: her views on the condition of St. Joseph's national school, Poppintree, Ballymun, Dublin 11, regarding the outstanding repairs and refurbishment to the school, which include, repairs to roof, tiles, resurfacing of playgrounds, replacement of carpets, tables, chairs and other such work; and if she will have arrangements made for an early meeting between her senior officials and the school board of management and staff representatives who wish to receive her Department's refurbishment plan for the school.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Ms Bhreathnach) Niamh Bhreathnach
Speaker.P: Remedial roof repairs are at present in progress at the St. Joseph's national school, Ballymun, Dublin 11. Further works will be considered in the light of a detailed report which has been requested from my Department's professional advisers.

Qst.Quest: the reason third level grants are unavailable to pharmaceutical technician students; and the reason a person (details supplied) in County Cork has been refused this grant.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Ms Bhreathnach) Niamh Bhreathnach
Speaker.P: The Pharmaceutical Technician's Diploma course in question is not currently an approved course for the purposes of student grants under my Department's student support schemes.
However, this course is currently being assessed to determine whether it satisfies the criteria for eligibility for student grant purposes. I will keep the Deputy informed of developments.

Qst.hpid: Mr. N. Ahern Mr. N. Ahern
Qst.Quest: if her Department or any other agency provides assistance towards crèche expenses for a lone parent third level student, living in private rented accommodation.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Ms Bhreathnach) Niamh Bhreathnach
Speaker.P: Maintenance grants paid under my Department's third level student support system are in respect of students' general living expenses. My Department does not provide any specific assistance towards crèche expenses of the type referred to by the Deputy, and I am not aware of any other agency which provides such assistance.

Qst.Quest: if she has received a request from the Christian Brothers secondary school, Youghal, County Cork, for assistance towards the cost of building a school hall; her views on whether such a facility is urgently needed in this school, where 450 students are now occupying a school built for 400 students; her views on whether the recreational facilities available to the students are therefore adequate; and if she will respond favourably to the request for funding.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Ms Bhreathnach) Niamh Bhreathnach
Speaker.P: An application has been received from this school for a grant to build a sports hall. In the light of the information received the school's accommodation requirements are being examined with a view to providing extra teaching space if necessary.

Due to demands on the capital resources available, priority has been given for some time to the provision of essential teaching spaces. As a result, it is not possible to make funding available at present for the provision of physical education facilities at existing schools without such facilities. The provision of indoor sports accommodation in existing schools, in the form of a general purpose area at primary level and a hall at secondary level, will resume as soon as pressure on available resources for urgent classroom accommodation has eased.

Qst.Quest: if she will have arrangements made with the manager of the Clare school bus scheme that the six qualifying children attending O'Callaghans Mills national school, County Clare, will be collected at The Lodge, Clogher instead of Derrymore Cross; and if he will make a statement on the matter.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Ms Bhreathnach) Niamh Bhreathnach
Speaker.P: I have had the issue raised by the Deputy examined by Bus Éireann who operate the school transport scheme on my behalf. I understand that none of the six children in question lives more than 1.5 miles from the present collection point. As this level of service is considered reasonable in the general context of school transport arrangements throughout the country, the extension requested would not be justified.
My Department has also been assured by Bus Éireann that the present collection point is satisfactory as far as its suitability as a pick-up and set-down point is concerned.

MainHeading.Title: Written Answers. - Junior Certificate Music Examination.

Qst.hpid: Mr. E. Ryan Mr. E. Ryan
Qst.Quest: if the practical examination will be held for junior certificate music examinations; and if she will make a statement on the matter.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Ms Bhreathnach) Niamh Bhreathnach
Speaker.P: The introduction of a practical test for all music students at junior certificate level is under consideration in my Department at present. I hope to be in a position to advise schools about the matter shortly.

Qst.Quest: if she intends providing finance for a new primary school at Coolea, Macroom, County Cork.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Ms Bhreathnach) Niamh Bhreathnach
Speaker.P: The proposed new school at Coolea, County Cork where the provision of grant-aid has already been agreed in principle will be considered for inclusion in the school building programme in due course in the light of available resources and other commitments and priorities.

Qst.hpid: Mr. B. O'Keeffe Mr. B. O'Keeffe
Qst.Quest: the amount of money spent on higher education and ESF grants for the school year 1993-1994.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Ms Bhreathnach) Niamh Bhreathnach
Speaker.P: The information sought by the Deputy in relation to the school year is not readily available as the expenditure data in question is recorded in respect of the financial year. The 1993 Estimates provision for recoupment to local authorities in respect of higher education grants is £42.75 million, and grants in support of trainees on ESF-aided programmes is £36.6 million.

MainHeading.Title: Written Answers. - County Limerick School Premises.

Qst.hpid: Mr. Noonan (Limerick East) Mr. Noonan (Limerick East)
Qst.Quest: the plans, if any, she has to ensure that a school (details supplied) in County Limerick will acquire or construct a suitable premises.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Ms Bhreathnach) Niamh Bhreathnach
Speaker.P: A number of options to accommodate the school referred to by the Deputy is being examined at the moment and I am awaiting reports from my Department's architects. When these reports have been considered I hope to be in a position to make a decision on the matter.

Qst.Quest: if, in view of the hardship involved, she will review an application for a higher education grant in respect of a person (details supplied) in County Laois; and if she will make a statement on the matter.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Ms Bhreathnach) Niamh Bhreathnach
Speaker.P: Laois County Council, as the relevant local authority, is the body statutorily entrusted with the administration of the higher education grants scheme in this case. It is understood from the council that the person in question has been deemed ineligible for a higher education grant on the basis that family reckonable income exceeded the prescribed income limit.

Qst.Quest: if she will ensure that a grant covering the full cost of transport will be made available in the case of a person (details supplied) in County Galway who attends class for hearing impaired children in Galway city; and if she will make a statement on the matter.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Ms Bhreathnach) Niamh Bhreathnach
Speaker.P: I am aware of the case referred to by the Deputy.

The position is that it was not possible to provide this pupil with a home pick-up set-down service due to the high costs involved. However, as an alternative my Department sanctioned a transport grant, not exceeding £460 per school year, towards the cost of private transport arrangements to link up with the existing special service to the school. The level of grant offered is determined by reference to the distance the pupil resides from the pick-up point on the service. The exact amount payable will depend on the pupil's attendance.
My Department is reviewing this arrangement at present to see if further improvements could be made.

Qst.Quest: if she has received a request for financial assistance from St. Paul's Primary School, North Brunswick Street, Dublin 7, for the construction of a home-school liaison office; if this type of project is grant-aided by her Department; and if, in view of the special circumstances of this school, the necessary assistance will be given.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Ms Bhreathnach) Niamh Bhreathnach
Speaker.P: An application for grant-aid for the provision of a home-school liaison office which was received two weeks ago is presently under consideration in my Department. It will be considered in due course in the light of available resources and other commitments and priorities.

Qst.hpid: Mr. D. McDowell Mr. D. McDowell
Qst.Quest: whether she will provide assistance to St. Davids School, Artane, Dublin 5, so that the school authorities can take measures to protect the school from vandalism; and whether she will provide for the erection of palisade fencing.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Ms Bhreathnach) Niamh Bhreathnach
Speaker.P: My Department has no application from St. David's school, Artane, Dublin 5 for grant assistance to enable the school authorities to take measures to protect the school from vandalism or for the erection of palisade fencing.
Any application received in this regard will be fully considered.

Qst.hpid: Mr. D. McDowell Mr. D. McDowell
Qst.Quest: whether she will consider extending eligibility under the third level grants scheme to persons who would otherwise qualify but for the fact that their parents do not reside in the relevant area.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Ms Bhreathnach) Niamh Bhreathnach
Speaker.P: Under the terms of the third level student support schemes the candidate's parents/guardians, or, in the case of an independent mature candidate, the candidate himself-herself, must be ordinarily resident in the administrative area of the local authority, or vocational education committee, as the case may be. However, local authorities and vocational education committees have discretion to waive this requirement in exceptional circumstances.

Qst.Quest: whether she will make finance available for the provision of a sports hall at Collinstown Park Community College, Rowlagh, Dublin 22, which is located in one of the most disadvantaged areas in the country and where, in a school of 800 pupils, there are no changing facilities or showers and physical education takes place in a small assembly hall; and if she will make a statement on the matter.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Ms Bhreathnach) Niamh Bhreathnach
Speaker.P: Due to demands on the capital resources available, priority has been given for some time to the provision of essential teaching spaces. As a result it is not possible in present circumstances to grant aid the provision of physical education facilities at existing schools without such facilities.
Provision of PE facilities in such schools will resume as soon as pressure on available resources for classroom accommodation has eased.

MainHeading.Title: Written Answers. - Remedial Teaching.

Qst.hpid: Mr. J. Higgins Mr. J. Higgins
Qst.Quest: the number of children in Cong national school, Cross national school and the Neale national school, County Mayo, who have been deemed by her Department as being in need of remedial teaching.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Ms Bhreathnach) Niamh Bhreathnach
Speaker.P: My Department has received an application for a remedial teacher from the three schools referred to by the Deputy, in which they indicated that there was a total of 74 children in those schools whom they consider are in need of remedial assistance.

MainHeading.P: I will be keeping the question of further need in this area under review as part of a broader commitment to appoint a substantial number of additional remedial teachers in the coming years. The needs of all schools, including the schools in question, will be considered in this context.

Qst.hpid: Mr. J. Higgins Mr. J. Higgins
Qst.Quest: the number of primary schools and the number of second level schools in County Sligo awaiting radon mitigation; the names of the schools in question; the names of the various companies which have tendered to date to carry out the work; the amount of the tender in the case of each company; and if she will make a statement on the matter.

Speaker.hpid: Minister for Education (Ms Bhreathnach) Niamh Bhreathnach
Speaker.P: There are 24 primary schools and three post-primary schools in Sligo where mitigation work has been recommended by the Radiological Protection Institute of Ireland towards the elimination of radon gas from the schools. In the case of the primary schools two specialist firms have tendered for the projects. These firms have also been invited to tender for the three second level schools in question.
It would not be appropriate to identify the schools involved or to provide details in relation to the tenders received.
